reasoning: Cobblestone lissencephaly is part of the Walker-Warburg syndrome spectrum, a severe neuronal migration disorder. Characterized by irregular cortical surface with cobblestone appearance. Overall lissencephaly incidence ~1-3 per 100k live births; cobblestone type represents approximately 5-10% of lissencephalies. Estimated cobblestone lissencephaly incidence: <0.2 per 100k births. Fewer than 500 cases documented globally.
source: Dobyns WB et al. (1999). Lissencephaly: A PCR approach to gene mapping. Am J Med Genet. 86(3):284-292
